News.headline: Match Report: Southport 1 - 4 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.page_title: Match Report: Southport 1 - 4 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: Southport 1 - 4 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.short_description: The Daggers got their fifth consecutive win in a row after defeating Southport away 1-4.
News.description:
It was the home team who took the lead in the 24th minute, but Jordan-Maguire got the equaliser in the 34th minute. Fejiri Okenabirihie contributed to two goals to give the Daggers a 3-1 lead into half time. Corey Whitely then got the final goal of the game in the second half.

John Still opted to make one change to his side, Jordan Maguire-Drew came in, after scoring the winner in last week’s match against Chester, for Luke Guttridge. 

It was a very quiet start to the match and it wasn’t until the 16th minute when Ryan Higgins centred a dangerous ball in, but no one was able to get on the end of it.

Two minutes later saw another chance for Southport, Ben McKenna’s first time half-volley, from 18 yards out, ended up just wide of Elliot Justham’s goal.

Southport was awarded a penalty, 24 minutes into the game, after Robbie Cundy was fouled inside the box by Joe Widdowson. Forward Jamie Allen stepped up and scored from the spot-kick, giving the Sandgrounders the lead.

Southport stopper Mason Springthorpe was shown a yellow card for catching the ball outside the box in the 33rd minute.

Maguire-Drew then gave the Daggers the lead after he fired the free-kick into the top corner of the goal.

The Daggers then took lead three minutes later, Okenabirhie’s pass across the box ended up bouncing of Cundy and into his own net.

It was a comfortable lead into half-time after the east Londoners scored a third in the 42nd minute. Oliver Hawkins played Okenabirhie through on goal and the forward then smashed into the top corner of the far post. 

Andrai Jones decided to test Justham five minutes into the second half, but the Daggers stopper managed to tip over the looping shot.

Jones had another good chance in the 68th minute, as he fired wide a volley on the turn, but Justham watched it go wide of his near post.

The second penalty of the match was awarded to the Daggers after a foul on Whitely in the 77th minute, the forward then scored from the spot.

A fifth goal nearly came three minutes later, Maguire-Drew whipped in a free kick and Shaun Donnellan’s header ended up going just wide.

The Daggers are now undefeated in five and will take on Guiseley on Saturday 18th February.
